title: The difference of composition between polygoni Multiflori Radix and Rhei Radix et Rhizoma revealed their primary hepatotoxicity components.
abstract: Polygoni Multiflori Radix (PMR) and Rhei Radix et Rhizoma (RRR), two commonly used traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) for the treatment of constipation, have raised safety concerns due to increasing reports of hepatorenal toxicity in recent years. Despite their therapeutic applications, the specific toxic components, dose-dependent effects, and molecular mechanisms underlying their toxicity remain poorly characterized.
